<<<<<<< HEAD
The proverb crossed, or, A new paradox maintained (viz.) that it is not at all times true, that interest cannot lye being a full, clear and distinct answer to a paper of an English gentleman, who endeavours to demonstrate that it is for the interest of England that the laws against transportation of wooll should be repealed. Carter, W. (William)
[2], 25 p.
Printed for authour, [London] : 1677.
Caption title: A full and clear answer to a paper intituled, Reasons for a limited exportation of wooll. Attributed to William Carter. Cf. Wing. Place of publication from Wing. Reproduction of original in Columbia University Library.
=======

Carter, W. (William)
[2], 25 p.
Printed for authour, [London] : 1677.
Caption title: A full and clear answer to a paper intituled, Reasons for a limited exportation of wooll. Attributed to William Carter. Cf. Wing. Place of publication from Wing. Reproduction of original in Columbia University Library.
